code.value:
// Mark identity nodes
CALL {
    MATCH (p)
    WHERE p.phase % 2 = 0 AND degree(p) = 2 AND p.t = 1
    SET p.is_identity = true
    RETURN COUNT(*) as marked
}

// Create new connections
CALL {
    MATCH (j)-[w1:Wire]-(p_start {is_identity: true})
    WHERE j.is_identity IS NULL
    MATCH path = (p_start)-[:Wire*0..10]-(p_end {is_identity: true})
    MATCH (p_end)-[w2:Wire]-(i)
    WHERE i.is_identity IS NULL AND id(j) < id(i)
      AND ALL(node IN nodes(path) WHERE node.is_identity = true)
      AND ALL(edge in relationships(path) WHERE edge.t = 1)
      
    WITH DISTINCT j, i, w1, w2,
          CASE
            WHEN w1.t = 2 OR w2.t = 2 THEN 2
            ELSE 1
          END AS new_t
    
    CREATE (j)-[w3:Wire {t: new_t}]->(i)
    RETURN COUNT(*) as created
}

// Delete identity nodes
CALL {
    MATCH (p {is_identity: true})
    DETACH DELETE p
    RETURN COUNT(*) as deleted
}

RETURN marked, created, deleted

// 1. Match the pattern and gather neighbors (excluding the n1-n2 edge)
MATCH (n1:Node {t:1})-[w:Wire {t:1}]-(n2:Node {t:2})

// Gather n1's neighbors (except n2), and the relationship types
OPTIONAL MATCH (n1)-[edge1]-(nb1)
WHERE id(nb1) <> id(n2)
WITH n1, n2, w, collect(nb1) AS n1_neighs, collect(edge1) AS n1_edges

// Gather n2's neighbors (except n1), and the relationship types
OPTIONAL MATCH (n2)-[edge2]-(nb2)
WHERE id(nb2) <> id(n1)
WITH n1, n2, w, n1_neighs, n1_edges, collect(nb2) AS n2_neighs, collect(edge2) AS n2_edges

// 2. Prepare to multiply nodes
WITH n1, n2, w, n1_neighs, n1_edges, n2_neighs, n2_edges,
     range(0, size(n1_neighs)-1) AS n1_idx,
     range(0, size(n2_neighs)-1) AS n2_idx

// 3. Create new nodes for n1 (t:2)
UNWIND n1_idx AS i1
CREATE (new_n1:Node {t:2, uuid: randomUUID(), original: id(n1)})
WITH n1, n2, w, n1_neighs, n1_edges, n2_neighs, n2_edges, collect(new_n1) AS new_n1s, n2_idx

// 4. Create new nodes for n2 (t:1)
UNWIND n2_idx AS i2
CREATE (new_n2:Node {t:1, uuid: randomUUID(), original: id(n2)})
WITH n1, n2, w, n1_neighs, n1_edges, n2_neighs, n2_edges, new_n1s, collect(new_n2) AS new_n2s

// 5. Reconnect previous edges for new_n1 nodes (index-safe)
WITH n1, n2, w, n1_neighs, n1_edges, n2_neighs, n2_edges, new_n1s, new_n2s
UNWIND range(0, size(new_n1s)-1) AS i
WITH n1_neighs[i] AS nb, n1_edges[i] AS edge, new_n1s[i] AS new_n1, n1, n2, w, n2_neighs, n2_edges, new_n2s
CREATE (new_n1)-[:Wire {t: edge.t}]->(nb)
WITH n1, n2, w, n2_neighs, n2_edges, new_n2s, collect(new_n1) AS new_n1s

// 6. Reconnect previous edges for new_n2 nodes (index-safe)
UNWIND range(0, size(new_n2s)-1) AS j
WITH n2_neighs[j] AS nb, n2_edges[j] AS edge, new_n2s[j] AS new_n2, new_n1s, n1, n2
CREATE (new_n2)-[:Wire {t: edge.t}]->(nb)
WITH new_n1s, collect(new_n2) AS new_n2s, n1, n2

// 7. Create all-to-all connections between the new nodes
UNWIND new_n1s AS n1x
UNWIND new_n2s AS n2x
CREATE (n1x)-[:Wire {t:1}]->(n2x)

// 8. Remove the original nodes and their connecting edge
WITH n1, n2
DETACH DELETE n1, n2

// 1. Match the fixed node and its properties
MATCH (fixedNode:Node {id: 10})

// 2. Create two new nodes, cloning properties
CREATE (newNodeA:Node)
SET newNodeA = fixedNode
SET newNodeA.id = randomUUID()
CREATE (newNodeB:Node)
SET newNodeB = fixedNode
SET newNodeB.id = randomUUID()

// 3. Reconnect wires from SetA to newNodeA, copying edge properties
WITH fixedNode, newNodeA, newNodeB
UNWIND [1] AS aId
MATCH (a:Node {id: aId})-[w:Wire]-(fixedNode)
WITH a, w, newNodeA, fixedNode, newNodeB
CREATE (a)-[newWire:Wire]->(newNodeA)
SET newWire = w  // Copies all properties from w to newWire
DELETE w

// 4. Reconnect wires from SetB to newNodeB, copying edge properties
WITH fixedNode, newNodeA, newNodeB
UNWIND [12, 13] AS bId
MATCH (b:Node {id: bId})-[w:Wire]-(fixedNode)
WITH b, w, newNodeB, fixedNode, newNodeA
CREATE (b)-[newWire:Wire]->(newNodeB)
SET newWire = w  // Copies all properties from w to newWire
DELETE w

// 5. Create a :Wire edge between the two new nodes (no properties needed here, or set as desired)
WITH newNodeA, newNodeB, fixedNode
MERGE (newNodeA)-[:Wire {t : 1, graph_id : newNodeA.graph_id}]->(newNodeB)

// 6. Remove the original fixed node
WITH fixedNode
DETACH DELETE fixedNode

// Step 1: Collect all matches into a list
MATCH (n1:Node {t: 1, phase: 3.141592653589793})-[]-(n2:Node {t: 2})
WHERE degree(n1) = 2
WITH n1, n2
LIMIT 1
MATCH (n1)-[r3]-(n3)
WHERE n3 <> n2
MERGE (n3)-[:Wire]->(n2)
SET n2.phase = -n2.phase

// Find all neighbors of n2 except n1
WITH n1, n2, n3
MATCH (n2)-[r2:Wire]-(n4)
WHERE n4 <> n1 AND n3 <> n4
WITH n1, n2, r2, n4

// Remove the original relationship
DELETE r2

// Create the inserted node and the two new relationships
WITH n1, n2, n4
CREATE (n1copy:Node {t: n1.t, phase: n1.phase, id: randomUUID()})
MERGE (n2)-[:Wire]->(n1copy)
MERGE (n1copy)-[:Wire]->(n4)

// Finally, remove n1
WITH n1
DETACH DELETE n1

MATCH (n1:Node {t: 1})-[r1]-(n2:Node {t: 2})
WHERE n1.phase % pi() = 0
WITH n1, n2, r1

// Find all neighbors of n2 except n1
MATCH (n2)-[r2]-(n3)
WHERE n3 <> n1

// Create a copy of n1 for each neighbor, connect to neighbor
CREATE (n1copy:Node {t: n1.t, phase: n1.phase, id: randomUUID()})
MERGE (n1copy)-[:Wire]->(n3)

// After all connections, remove n2 and all its relationships
WITH n2
DETACH DELETE n2

items.title: Turn Hadamard edges into Hadamard boxes

code.value:
// Find all Hadamard edges and convert them to Hadamard gate nodes
MATCH (a)-[h:Wire {t: 2}]->(b)
WITH a, b, h
CREATE (hadamard:Node {t: 3, phase: 1, graph_id: a.graph_id})
CREATE (a)-[:Wire {t: 1}]->(hadamard)
CREATE (hadamard)-[:Wire {t: 1}]->(b)
DELETE h
RETURN COUNT(*) as hadamard_gates_created

items.title: Turn Hadamard gates into Hadamard edges

code.value:
MATCH p = ()-[]-()
OPTIONAL MATCH (v)
RETURN p, v

MATCH
  (n0)-[w1:Wire {t: 2}]-(n1:Node {t: 1}),
  (n1)-[w2:Wire {t: 2}]-(n2:Node {t: 1}),
  (n2)-[w3:Wire]-(n3)
WHERE
  degree(n1) = 2 AND
  degree(n2) = 2 AND
  n1.phase % 2 = 0 AND
  n2.phase % 2 = 0
WITH n0, n1, n2, n3, w1, w2, w3, properties(w3) AS w3props
DELETE w1, w2, w3
DETACH DELETE n1, n2
CREATE (n0)-[newWire:Wire]->(n3)
SET newWire = w3props

// Find mixed-type node pairs (only once per pair)
MATCH (a), (b)
WHERE (a.t = 1 AND b.t = 2) OR (a.t = 2 AND b.t = 1)
  AND id(a) < id(b)  // This ensures we process each pair only once
  AND EXISTS((a)-[:Wire]-(b))  // Only pairs that actually have edges

// Count ALL edges with connection_count property (regardless of direction)
MATCH (a)-[edge:Wire]-(b)
WHERE edge.connection_count IS NOT NULL AND id(a) < id(b)
WITH a, b, COUNT(edge) as connection_count_edges

// Apply Hopf rule: if connection_count_edges > 1, take modulo
WITH a, b, connection_count_edges,
     CASE 
       WHEN connection_count_edges > 2 THEN connection_count_edges % 2
       ELSE 1  // Keep edges if â‰¤ 1 edge with connection_count
     END as should_keep_edges

// Collect all edges between these nodes (both with and without connection_count)
MATCH (a)-[edge:Wire]-(b)
WHERE id(a) < id(b)
WITH a, b, should_keep_edges, COLLECT(edge) as all_edges

// If should_keep_edges = 0 (even modulo), delete all edges
WITH a, b, should_keep_edges, all_edges,
     CASE 
       WHEN should_keep_edges = 0 THEN all_edges  // Delete all if even
       ELSE all_edges[1..]  // Keep all if odd
     END as edges_to_delete

UNWIND edges_to_delete as edge_to_delete
DELETE edge_to_delete

RETURN COUNT(DISTINCT a) as pairs_processed

// Find all node pairs that have any edges between them
MATCH (a)-[edge:Wire]-(b)
WHERE id(a) < id(b)  // Process each pair only once

// Collect all edges between each pair
WITH a, b, COLLECT(edge) as all_edges
WHERE size(all_edges) > 1  // Only process pairs with multiple edges

// Keep the first edge, delete the rest
WITH a, b, all_edges[0] as edge_to_keep, all_edges[1..] as edges_to_delete

UNWIND edges_to_delete as edge
DELETE edge

RETURN COUNT(DISTINCT a) as node_pairs_processed,
       SUM(size(edges_to_delete)) as total_edges_removed

MATCH (n)
OPTIONAL MATCH (n)--(m)
WITH n, count(m) AS degree
WITH degree, count(*) AS frequency
RETURN degree, frequency
ORDER BY degree;
